data.title: So I cannot play my Animal Crossing save on two Switches?
data.meta_description: For Animal Crossing: New Horizons on the Nintendo Switch, a GameFAQs message board topic titled "So I cannot play my Animal Crossing save on two Switches?".
data.text:
For example, main Switch would be for at home, and then if I wanted to take my Switch Lite to work, can I or can I not play the same save file?

Its cheaper and still portable just to have a regular switch / oled model.

But yeah before the game came out they made it well known that their save style is different.

The island itself is bound to the switch, not user account.

Therefore you can have up to 8 human players build houses and share experiences on that same island. The design is pro family at home. Your daughter/son/brother/sister could pick up another controller and jump in and help farm items etc. The concept is fine (not asinine, its a really good idea) but not what people expected.

So the fact you can't xfer via cloud saves makes sense since the island is on your home console.

Now you CAN transfer (move, not copy) the entire island to your other switch, which then essentially deletes it off your other one using the island transfer tool. Then xfer your character saves from one console to the other, but that's time consuming and a pain in the butt. It's also part of an attempt at making sure people earn their items and not dupe by abusing cloud saves. Problem is people spam "treasure islands" with hacked saves anyway... (I avoid, defeats purpose of game, and also you might pick up hacked items you can never drop)

Pokemon also doesn't cloud save to avoid duping. Especially makes sense here as there is the competitive scene which is supposed to be showing off the fruits of your breeding / training / synergy expertise.

Every time someone tells me they are thinking of buying a switch lite I tell them its a scam. You can't connect to a TV, therefore can't record / livestream footage, can't play certain games without buying additional joycons making it a more expensive console than the other ones, and can't send in JUST the joycons and have to say byebye to your whole console when they exhibit stick drift.
